content.description: This is unrepeated despite attempts by many strong climbers. Begin between Atlantis and Purple Haze on the rock slab. Extremely difficult micro fingernail edges up a shallow scoop (V10+)  lead to the horizontal band where Atlantis ends it's leftward traverse at a good cobble. From there, tricky V4 edges and pockets lead to a heady topout.  I worked on this with Mike Waugh & Jan McCollum for several days and spent the better part of 15 or more days attempting it.
content.protection: You should bring your best highball head for this one. Although pads were not used on the F.A. they would be nice.  Despite rumors to the contrary, the landing is unchanged from the time of the 1st ascent.
content.location: Located between Atlantis and Purple Haze, it climbs a shallow scoop off the sloping slab directly to the good cobble jug where Atlantis goes straight up after it's leftwards traverse at about 12' high.  The holds are tiny, micro edges. and the right hand hold is 2 seperate one finger super thin edges.

content.description: When looking at the little jug on purple prow on the big overhanging prow section, purple squeeze climbs the left arête.  Just like name of the climb, the climb squeezes up the arête using slopers and strong compression moves.  Finishes straight up.
content.location: NE end of Naked Edge Boulder

content.description: Climb up the big flake to a sloping mantle at a ledge. Be careful not to fall on opposite facing boulder.
content.location: In a narrow corridor, obvious big flake on the face left of Purple Squeeze on the Purple Prow boulder. Faces opposite of the Colorado Arete V4.

content.description:
Beautiful route in the northeast side of the naked edge boulder.  The climb starts down low on cobble edges, works straight up a series of crimps on the right side of the arête and then moves left going under the prow to the little jug.  From here, continue moving left and then up the obvious edges to the top.

This is a proud send and a must do if you climb at the grade!
content.protection: Relatively flat landing so 2 pads is probably fine.
content.location: On the east end of the naked edge boulder.
